headline: Chantal's New York Cheesecake
description: This New York cheesecake recipe is super easy to make. Why go out to get this favorite dessert when you can make your own at home? Delicious!

video.description: See how to make a top-rated cheesecake.
video.name: Chantal’s New York Cheesecake

name: Chantal's New York Cheesecake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
Mix graham cracker crumbs and melted butter together in a medium bowl until well combined.
Press onto the bottom of the prepared pan to make a packed crust.
Mix cream cheese and sugar together in a large bowl until smooth. Blend in milk, then mix in eggs, one at a time, until just combined.
Add sour cream, flour, and vanilla; mix until smooth.
Pour filling onto prepared crust. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour.
Turn the oven off; let cheesecake cool in the oven with the door closed for 5 to 6 hours to prevent cracking. Chill in the refrigerator until serving.

review.reviewBody: I have been making this for a few years now. It always gets rave reviews like “so creamy and rich” “just the best”. My hubbie loves it❤️ thanks! Deb

This was my first time making cheesecake and OMG, it was the perfect recipe! It's a very creamy version that really accentuates the cream cheese and sour cream flavors. I followed the recipe exactly except that I used double the butter in the graham cracker crust because 2 tbsp didn't seem like enough. (I actually wasn't sure if 15 graham crackers meant 15 of the whole big rectangle sheets that they come in, but I did use 15 of those and it seemed like an appropriate-sized crust.) Drizzled with some decorating gel to celebrate our team for the super bowl. :-)

heaven. added a little lemon zest, baked at 350 for the first 15 minutes, then dropped the temp to 250 for the last 45 minutes. changed the servings to 9 (3 packages of cream cheese) and used only 2 rounded tablespoons of flour. Spray the sides, no water bath. yummy

Been using this recipe for years. Its creamy and smooth and delicious with any topping or just plain. I always a couple tablespoons of fresh lemon juice and a water bath. Great with caramel sauce on it!!

Listen people. I’ve been making this recipe (minus the flour bc I’m gluten free) for 13 years and never had a problem. I love making it before I go to bed, let cool in the oven, get up in the morning and transfer to the fridge. Sometimes there’s a crack but it’s not very often. I just fill it with topping if there is. No. Big. Deal. The flavor is what matters and I’ve had over 50 different people try this guy over the years and everyone has always loved it.

First of all, thanks to Chantal for submitting the recipe. It's similar to other cheesecake recipes I've made in the past except the bake time. I followed the recipe precisely, twice, and both times the finished product came out with the filling very dry and the crust very over baked. Baking at 350 for 1 hour and then leaving it in the oven for 5-6 hours with the door closed is far to much time. The cheesecake still cracked and as mentioned earlier produced an overcooked result. If I make this recipe again I will reduce the overall time to 2 hours.
I’ve made this numerous times with perfect results. Just make sure to let in oven for at least 5-6 hours before cooling in refrigerator, and you will have a beautiful cheesecake!
My number 1 go to cheesecake recipe, love it
I've been making this for years ,it is the best recipe out there and super easy
I made this exactly as the recipe says twice. the first time it did crack. the second time I made sure there was more water in the pan, and it came out beautiful

This is the ultimate New York Cheesecake! It is perfect in every way. I followed the recipe as written and it came out great. It did crack but that may be because I couldn’t help myself and opened the oven door. So, I had the cracked slice (so I could pretend it had less calories lol). My boyfriend grew up in NY and told me it was the best cheesecake he ever had. I agree! Even his extremely opinionated and picky eater business partner said this is the real deal. I will make this cheesecake again and again! Thank you Chantal, for sharing!

After seeing some pics of other cheesecakes made with this recipe, I baked it at 325 degrees for 15 minutes longer, then left it in the oven an hour after turning it off. Perfection! No cracks, texture consistent throughout and it shrank evenly when it cooled. Will make again.

I basically followed the recipe with some modifications found on other reviewers. I used room temperature ingredients. Cooled it in the oven for 2 hours. The cake tastes great. It did crack. More butter is needed for the crust. I will make it again just adding more butter. I am okay with the cracking still tastes great!
Perfect - I've made it twice and it's the best recipe.

This recipe may actually be very good for someone with more experience baking cheesecakes than me. In 20/20 hindsight, I can see I really should have read through more of these supportive responses beforehand. Who knows though maybe, despite all the deep chasms, it will taste wonderful. I hope so. :-)

I have much more experience with main dishes than with deserts but I decided to take on this challenge. I followed the recipe exactly and the cheesecake turned out perfectly. None of the things I feared happened: the filling set, there were no cracks, it released easily from the spring form pan. Most importantly, it was a delicious New York-style cheesecake.
PERFECT
I've been making this recipe for years and it comes out perfect everytime. It is a big crowd pleaser.

I've made this recipe multiple times with perfect results every time. It is seriously my favorite dessert. It is so rich and creamy. I follow other reviewer's suggestions and add cinnamon & sugar and extra butter to the crust for more flavor. I also use room temp ingredients, bake it in a bain marie, avoid overmixing, and sift my flour well before adding, so it doesn't get lumpy.
The best New York style cheesecake recipe yet. It was so good that family requested it for Thanksgiving. Thank you Chantal and allrecipes.
OMG! THIS IS GREAT!!!
Love it! Everyone raves about the flavor and texture
Turns out perfectly every time!

This is the only cheesecake recipe I Use. My Family absolutely loves it. I sometimes use a shortbread crust and sometimes use graham cracker crust. Whatever Crust I use cheesecake is perfect, I usually put a jar of hersheys caramel sauce and heath bar crunch you can find in the baking isle. PERFECT GOODNESS!!

BEST CHEESECAKE RECIPE EVER. I've made it at least a dozen times. It is the best ever, exactly as written. This cheesecake gets requested ALL THE TIME by my work colleagues. FANTASTIC RECIPE. THANK YOU for sharing it!
Perfect!
Lovely cheesecake, easy to make. Turned out so pretty!

I've made this recipe at least a dozen times, and it comes put perfect almost everytime. If you follow the directions to a T then it will be perfect. You cannot over blend the cheesecake bc it will Crack and you have to leave oven alone after you turn it off, don't open to check it out!!.. Great recipe!!
Simply Awesome
I make this all the time. Loved by everyone ❤
I followed the filling recipe exactly and it was great. Perfect amount of sweetness for my taste. I did alter the crust though slightly. Adding some cinnamon, nutmeg, and sugar.

I don't know how you could not give this 5 stars. I have made this recipe several dozen times and it's always so high and creamy. I get rave reviews every time I make it and yes, I follow the recipe. If it doesn't turn out right for you, It's either your oven or you but it is certainly not the recipe. It's perfect!
Tried the recipe because that is my daughter-in-law's name and I couldn't be happier I did. It is absolutely delicious and everyone who has had it agrees it is the best they have ever had.
Everything came out good but the top sorry if burned a bit. Otherwise yum!

So I made this totally lactose free for my first time ever making a cheesecake I think it came out pretty good a little dark on the edges and a split down the middle but a knife and strawberries will take care of that the flavors are there thanks to my cousin for a tip on an egg white to keep the crust from crumbling
Fantastic and easy. Full of flavor. Next time I'm going to reduce the graham crackers by a third. I prefer a thinner crust
I’ve been using this recipe for almost 10 years now and it never disappoints. It always produces an amazing cheesecake!
It was perfect! My husband (hard to impress) gave it a 10! I double wrapped the spring form pan and put it in a pie plate with water in it. No cracks! I’m making one for my family on Easter. 🐣

I add lemon Zest & juice of 1 lemon, 1/4tsp nutmeg to my Graham cracker crust and use two packages of gram crackers I also add lemon zest & juice of 1 lemon …change the amount of liquid as well (3/4 c milk & 1/4 c vanilla cream (1cup total)), & another1/4 c of flour 5,200 feet altitude I have to add liquid & flour. I use a water bath and leave the cheese cake in until oven for the 6 hours… in a water bath… it comes out perfect! This recipe is the closest to my original recipe that I lost years ago in house fire… It’s delicious every time!

Incredible recipe for cheesecake. The perfect texture and flavor. I topped mine with the classic New York cheesecake sour cream topping. My husband drizzled caramel on his. Good cake recipe to bring to a party!

This was my first attempt at baking cheesecake. The filling was a little sweeter than I wanted it. I also changed the crust so that there was more butter and some sugar in it to make sure the crust will stay together once it sets in the refrigerator. I used whole wheat digestive biscuits instead of graham crackers. Make sure your ingredients are at room temperature. My cream cheese was still a little cold and it was too thick for my hand mixer to beat it. To resolve that, I let the cream cheese and sugar sit in the oven on low heat (60C) for 10-15 minutes and that did the job. Notes: I steam baked it with boiling water. In the end, one hour was not enough for the cheesecake to be fully cooked (I found out after letting it rest in the oven for 6 hours). What I did to fix that was steam bake it again (at the temperature in instructions) for nearly 15 minutes. It turned out perfect and I loved it. My mother approves of it!

This is the best cheesecake I have ever made. I was easy to make and the results were great. The only thing is that the cheesecake did get a little browner that I had hoped but the taste was amazing. I made it again and dropped the temperature to 340 degrees and the results were much better. I will definitely be making this recipe again soon. Thanks for sharing
This is so easy and, hands down, my family's favorite!

I'v made this a few times now and the top has cracked each time but it's nothing a few cherries along with a few tablespoons of left over crust sprinkled on top won't cure. The taste is consistent and great! This is my go to when taking a dessert somewhere. Always a hit
I was apprehensive, but this will be my Go To cheesecake recipe from now on. Quite amazing!
I have been using this recipe for years. I always get rave reviews.
perfect!
This recipe was perfect! My top did crack but I topped it with an espresso ganache instead of the fruit; you couldn't tell there was a crack and it was delicious.
I'm guessing the flour is used to help thicken the milk used in the recipe. It's pretty gross, can't understand the high rating. Use heavy cream, not milk and do not use flour, ever, in a cheesecake.
Very much enjoyed! I ended up having to add a little more butter to the crust, but it was delicious. I brought it to Christmas dinner and everyone loved it!
Best-tasting cheesecake ever!
I have made this cheesecake several times over the last few years. It is so creamy & luscious! It’s now my “go-to” cheesecake recipe

I’ve been making this recipe for years now, and it’s great. The only thing I do different is substitute corn starch for the flour. Also, I bake using the water bath method which almost always results in a smooth top with no cracking.
Best ever cheesecake recipe! I've been using this recipe for years and everybody loves it. Sometimes I add mini chocolate chips, sometimes I top with chocolate ganache. It is always wonderful.
I'm not sure what I did differently this year, but both my cheesecakes cracked three hours into oven cooling. Ugh!
Great

This was a really good cheesecake recipe. I followed the recipe "as is" the first time, but made it in a water bath. I plan to make it again, but I will eliminate the milk and cut back the flour next time. I could taste the flour in this, it was too much for my personal taste. It was still very good though and a "keeper" recipe for sure!

I followed this recipe without modifications over 10 times. The keys to a perfect, no crack, pretty cheesecake is ALL room temperature ingredients and lower the oven setting to 325 degrees and put a pan of water in the oven with the cheesecake. NOT A WATER BATH! Put the pan with the water in the oven while preheating the oven and then leave it on the bottom rack while cheesecake bakes above.
Amazing recipe, didn’t change a thing. It’s my go to birthday cake. Kids and hubby love it. Gave the recipe to all who tasted it. If I could give it 10 stars, I would :)
Best recipe.

I made it...didn't read the reviews...cracked but delicious. Then, I read the reviews and remade 2 days later. I used a blender for the cream cheese and sugar, then I used a wooden spoon for the rest. I did, however, slightly whisk the eggs before blending with wooden spoon. The difference? First go around, used a blender the while time...only 80% of filling fit in pan. Second time, only used mixer for cream cheese and sugar...all of the filling fit. I followed suggestions and set a timer for 60 minutes. I did not touch the oven door...did not peak. The timer went off and I turned off the oven and went to cleaning. Approximately 2-3 hours later, removed from oven, removed from pan and refrigerated until the next evening. I have been asked to add this Cheesecake to bakery menu. Bravo...its a keeper. -Baker Betty
This was very easy to make and tasted great

Great recipe! I’ve made this many, many times, most recently yesterday. I made two small easy changes this time, and it made it by far the best I’ve ever had. I added about half a teaspoon of cinnamon to the graham cracker crust, and about a tablespoon of lemon juice to the batter, mixed in with the vanilla. Wow, next level cheesecake!

This was great, just as the reviews noted. 
No water bath needed, just follow the dummy-proof instructions and it’ll come out with no cracks. This was my very first time to make a cheesecake ever. It came out great thanks to the awesome instructions!
This is a purist NY cheesecake as has been noted too. Rich, thick, packed with flavor. 
I added cinnamon and a pinch of nutmeg to the crust for a little extra compliment to the rich and creamy flavor. 
It was hard to share this.

I have made this several times. It is the easiest and most fool proof cheesecake recipe that I have ever made. It is very easy to adjust it to make flavors. I have done lemon, pumpkin and raspberry. I highly recommend this recipe!!

I have been making this cheesecake for years, just never got around to writing a review until now. This time I made just a plain vanilla bean cheesecake. This is the easiest cheesecake recipe to make and can be used as a base for many different flavors. It is the only one I have ever made that doesn't crack and it is so creamy. The 2 very most important directions to follow are... Do NOT overbeat. And leave it in the oven to cool. I set my oven for 1 hour and it shuts off after an hour. I don't open it at all to check on it or anything. The next morning, I put it in the refrigerator and that night, it is perfect for dessert! The cheesecake will come out perfect every single time.
Extra Creamy Cheesecake! I used a Bain Marie and as you can see, NO CRACKS!

I followed the recipe. It turned out beautifully. I make cheesecakes and have many great recipes. This is NOT one of them. I did not like the flavor and family agreed that this is our least favorite ever.

I have made this recipe for years, the only thing i do differently is water bathe it. it rises and becomes more fluffy My son is a chef and taught me that way my husband loves Cheesecake, i do not....and he also loves cherries. It pretty much comes out perfect every time
It was TO DIE FOR. So perfect, looked decent but tasted out of this world. Not too difficult either. I will always use this recipe

Great recipe with some slight modifications. First starters, I use a different graham cracker recipe. 15 graham crackers, 1/2 cup butter, 1/3 cup white sugar, and 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon.
As for the cheesecake itself, I follow the recipe exactly as is, but being extra careful how I mix everything. I use a mixer for the cream cheese and sugar until smooth. I then switch over to a wooden spoon for the milk, eggs, sour cream, vanilla, and flour. Once everything is mixed, I will use the blender for a quick sec at the end to make sure it's smooth. 
I also highly recommend a water bath! Wrap the springform pan with some heavy duty aluminum foil and place in a larger roasting pan, then pour boiling water in the roasting pan before placing in the oven.
And just like the recipe says, cook for an hour and then turn off the oven without opening the oven door. Leave in the oven for 5-6 hours and then I refrigerate overnight until I'm ready to serve.

I have never made a cheesecake before, but I am a big fan of NY style cheesecake. We decided to attempt this and it came out perfect! It was so easy, too! We did keep it in the oven an extra 15 min because it looked a little loose in the center still, but that either did the trick or at least didn't ruin the cake!! My whole family agreed the cheesecake was restaurant quality!! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe.
Followed recipe as written except let it sit in the oven for 60 minutes. Perfection
whole family loved it

Delicious and easy to follow recipe, especially for my first time ever making a cheesecake! I highly recommend adding some orange and lemon zest into the mix before baking it, as this gives it a nice, citrusy taste that I personally really enjoy.

My first time making cheese cake and I chose this one because of the simplicity yet authentic outcome expectation. The only changes I made were subbing half-n-half for milk, shortbread cookies instead of graham crackers for the crust, and added Hershey's chocolate syrup to make it a chocolate swirl cake. I had to cook it an additional 20 mins after it cooled 3 hours as it was too loose/not set up in the middle. The next evening my husband, who is from Bronx, NY, had it for his birthday and said it was better than the best NY restaurant cheese cake he had ever had... and he is very particular. Texture was perfectly smooth, nothing like the dryer, chunkier, cheese cakes I have had, and not sour but sweeter. I will be making this again! Yes, the top is dark due to the chocolate, not burnt or dry.
Forgot to spray the pan but it turned out amazing for Valentine’s Day

Trying to figure out how this rated so many five star reviews. 

It was OK. I have had better. Still it made a decent dessert and was good with strawberry topping and probably could have done service for a gathering... but I think I am going to keep looking for something better. 

I found it too sweet and too cakey.

OMG This is the best New York Cheesecake ever. The only things I did to change it was to add the juice of 2 lemons for more of a lemon flavor. Out standing taste. This a base that you can work with on flavor you want.

I followed the recipe to a "T" , including waiting 24 hours to taste, it was so easy but was absolutely to die for. Tasted like the cheesecake i used to drive to Montreal for! Did not use any water bath or anything! For those that said this was no good, it has to be the... well lets just say it makes no sense!
Fantastic Recipe!
Great!

Amazing! This tastes like I picked it up at my local bakery and truly does taste just like a New York style cheesecake. I used the exact ingredients, the only thing I did differently was cooking it. I wrapped my springform pan in foil and placed it in a large dish of hot water (based on some other reviews). After one hour of cooking the cake looked like batter still, so I kept cooking it ~15-20minutes. Just till I could see a little bit of firmness or coloring on top. I turned off the oven and let it sit for only 3 hours, because I didn't have time for 6 hours. It was just barely toasty on top, perfect color!! My husband absolutely LOVED it and said it was the best dessert I've ever made! Thanks!!

If I could give this 6 stars I would. This is tall, fluffy texture but still dense and rich, moist and not a single crack. I’ve made this with and without crusts. I’ve added vanilla bean with extract, vanilla bean paste, or just extract. I always use a Bain Marie. Otherwise I don’t change anything. I cook it exact same temp and leave the door closed for at least 4 hours. If this recipe doesn’t work for you, you’re probably not getting ingredients to room temp or over mixing. And don’t use low fat anything, you will NOT get the same amazing results. All of my lumps did not disappear before I put it in springform. I take it off stand mixer as soon as it looks incorporated, then a few folds with my spatula.

I've made this now at least half a dozen times. It rivals restaurant cheesecake. The only thing I do differently is I make the crust from 2 cups graham cracker crumbs, 1/2 cup butter and two tablespoons sugar instead of using crackers themselves.

This was delicious!!! But, really it was so great from all the tips in the reviews. 1)Room Temp Ingredients 2)cooking at 325 instead of 350. 3) My tip, I used WHOLE milk 4) For the crust 1 1/2 cup grahams, 1 cup sugar, 1 tsp ground cinnamon, 1/4 cup butter, I cooked this in the spring pan for about 10 minutes at 325. Let it cool completely 5)Fill a large pan with about 1/3 water place on the BOTTOM RACK and set the oven 325, let the water get hot where you see steam. Then put your cheesecake on the rack above. Cooked the cheesecake 1 hour 15 minutes. Did not open the oven. Turned the oven off and let the cheesecake above the water sit for 6 hours. Did not open the Oven!!!! Delicious!!

The cheesecake component of this is downright perfect. The right consistency, the right flavor, the perfect balance of sweet and savory of a new york style cheesecake. This was designed for a crush that was only at the bottom of the pan, not running around the edges of the cake, so do use more graham crackers if you want crust on more than the bottom.

I followed the directions exactly. It still had huge cracks. The texture is way too spongey for cheesecake, NY or otherwise. The crust falls apart even though I packed it very well. I hate this recipe. I will never use it again. What a waste.

I have made this several times. I love it. To be fair, i never follow a recipe exactly. I use oreo cookie crumbs for crus, or i used to. Now i make dark chocolate and blend with oreo crumbs for a crust. Use a water bath while baking. Remove from bath to cool in the oven, be careful while doing this. Parchment paper in bottom of spring form pan is helpful. In 2019 i took this to a friends Thanksgiving gathering and they hid it from their the guest so they could have more of it. Enjoy.

I made this with a gluten free crust, using a couple different GF graham crackers. Oh my! So perfectly delicious. Be sure and leave it in the oven after baking. It makes me happy. Also I used 1/4 cup gluten free flour. Everything else was exactly per the recipe. Perfection!

This is amazing. I followed the directions the first time. I added some sugar to the crust the second time and every time since. It always cracks but it tastes so amazing that no one cares. Best chilled as the crust crisps. I serve it with strawberry glaze. Just perfect.
The only cheesecake I make. Wonderful!
Simple recipe I let my 10 year old make it

I’ve made this cheesecake as written several times and it’s always a hit. Here are some thoughts after trying it several times: 1. Do not over mix. This causes the cake to rise and split (yesterday’s version looked like a soufflé). 2. Cook at 325 instead of 350...I’ve done it on both and 325 worked better for me. 3. The recipe doesn’t call for a water bath which gives it a nice cheesecake consistency. If you want a more custard-like texture, do a water bath. 4. Line the bottom of the tin with parchment paper if you want to remove this from the tin. I had issues taking it off. This cake has only cracked twice for me and I just hide it with a fruit compote.

Came out great and tastes excellent!! Super easy to make and for my first time, I’m quite impressed with myself lol! I used a water bath and spiced my crust with cinnamon, nutmeg and brown/white sugar. SUPERB!!
Always a tasty treat.

This makes a FABULOUS Cheesecake!!!! I’ve made it a few times now and it comes out perfectly every time! I followed suggestions of others and added some cinnamon & sugar to the graham crackers - and reduced flour to 2tsp.

First off - thank you to all the other reviewers because ya’all had excellent tips/tricks!!! This was one of the best cheesecakes i’ve ever had. Creamy, smooth, delicious, not cracked, didnt sink. Great recipe!
Turned out great
Thank you Chantal !! I have made this recipe for the last 14 years!!! Every year my family requests this for our Christmas table!!!!!
